53524 THE SALT CESS ACT, 1953
ACT NO. 49 OF 1953 [ 26th December, 1953.]
An Act to provide for the levy and collection of a cess on salt for the purpose of raising funds to meet the expenses incurred on the salt organisation maintained by Government and on the measures taken by Government in connection with the manufacture, supply and distribution of salt.
1379934 1 Short title, extent and commencement.
1058636 1This Act may be called the Salt Cess Act, 1953.
712649 2It extends to the whole of India 1.
571021 3It shall come into force on such 2 date as the Central Government may, by notification in the Official Gazette, appoint.
1971826 2 Definitions. In this Act, unless the context otherwise requires,--
1193528 a" manufacture" in relation to salt includes collection, removal, preparation, steeping, evaporation, boiling or any one or more of these processes, the separation or purification of salt obtained in the manufacture of saltpetre, the separation of salt from earth or other substance so as to produce alimentary salt, and the excavation or removal of natural saline deposits or efflorescence; and the word manufacturer' shall be construed accordingly and shall include not only a person who employs hired labour in the production or manufacture of a salt but also any person who engages in its production or manufacture on his own account if the salt is intended for sale. Explanation.-- In this clause, saltpetre' includes rasi sajji, and all other substances manufactured from saline earth, and kharinun and every form of sulphate or carbonate of soda;
1083085 b' salt' includes swamp salt, spontaneous salt, and salt or saline solutions made or produced from any saline substances or from salt earth; The Act comes into force in Pondicherry on 1. 10. 1963 vide Reg. 7 of 1963, s. 3 and Sch. I.
Extended to and brought into force in Dadra and Nagar Haveli (w. e. f. 1- 7- 1965) by Reg. 6 of 1963, s. 2 and Sch. I. and in Goa, Daman and Diu (w. e. f. 1- 6- 1969) by notificaation No. So. 2872, Dated 4- 6- 1969
724 1The words" except the State of Jammu and Kashmir" omitted by Act 62 of 1956, s. 2 and Sch. 2 2nd January, 1954, vide Notification No. S. R. O. 2378, dated the 29th December, 1953, see Gazette of India, Extraordinary. 1953, Pt. II, Sec. 3, p. 3601.
1677020 c" salt factory" includes--
1064048 ia place used or intended to be used in the manufacture of salt and all embankments, reservoirs, condensing and evaporating pans, buildings, and waste places situated within the limits of such place, as defined from time to time for the purposes of the Central Excises and Salt Act, 1944; (1 of 1944)
1216234 iiall drying grounds and storage platforms and storehouses appurtaining to any such place;
733690 iiiland on which salt is spontaneously produced; 1
2
1511269 e" prescribed" means prescribed by rules made under this Act.
1724307 33 Levy and collection of cess on salt. There shall be levied and collected in such manner as may be prescribed, a cess in the nature of an excise duty at the rate of fourteen naye paise per forty kilograms on all salt manufactured in India in any salt factory, whether owned by Government or not.]
678185 4 Application of proceeds of cess. The proceeds of the duty levied under this Act, reduced by the cost of collection as determined by the Central Government, shall, if Parliament by appropriation made by law in this behalf so provides, be utilised on all or any of the following objects, namely:--
1053171 ameeting the expenditue incurred in connection with the salt organisation maintained by the Central Government;
1182045 bmeeting the cost of measures taken in connection with the manufacture, supply and distribution of salt by Union agencies and the regulation and control of the manufacture, supply and distribution of salt by other agencies; and in particular, measures for--
1376283 ithe establishment and maintenance of research stations and model salt farms;
1056776 iithe establishment, maintenance and expansion of salt factories; 725 1Certain words omitted by Act 34 of 1961, s. 2. 2 Cl. (d) omitted by s. 2, ibid. 3 Subs. by s. 3. ibid., for s. 3.
27433 iiifixing the grades of salt;
1207973 ivpromoting and encouraging co- operative effort among manufacturers of salt; and
444926 vpromoting the welfare of labour employed in the salt industry.
1532109 5 Validation of charges levied on salt before the commencement of this Act. The charge in respect of the manufacture or production of salt imposed by the rule made by the Central Government under section 37 of the Central Excises and Salt Act, 1944 (1 of 1944) and published with the notification of the former Finance Department (Revenue Division) No. 3 dated the 29th March, 1947, shall be deemed to have been levied under this Act as if this Act was in force on the day on which the charge was so imposed and accordingly,--
848162 aany sum paid or payable by way of such charge shall be deemed to heve been paid or payable in accordance with the law; and
252168 bno claim shall lie in any Court for the refund of any such so paid.
720653 6 Power to make rules.
961387 1The Central Government may, by notification in the Official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Act.
676737 2In particular and without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing power, such rules may provide for--
874703 athe assessment and collection of the cess levied under this Act;
1707511 bthe determination of the cost of collection of the cess;
868562 cthe manner in which accounts relating to the proceeds of the cess shall be maintained;
857507 dthe manner in which the proceeds of the cess may be applied on the object specified in section 4;
1581651 ethe exemption from the whole or any part of the cess levied under this Act--
1581018 iin respect of salt exported from India;
1401003 iiin respect of salt manufactured by any specified categories of small manufacturers; and
1166261 iiiin respect of salt utilised in the manufacture of any other product of industry.
